bio:treatment.discussion: Isoëtes engelmannii is the most widely distributed quillwort of eastern North America. Plants with larger megaspores, ranging from 480--560 μm, have been called I. engelmannii var. georgiana Engelmann. This variety may represent a tetraploid cytotype. A tetraploid population of I. engelmannii (2n = 44) from northern Florida has larger megaspores characteristic of var. georgiana.

Isoëtes engelmannii hybridizes with I. echinospora [ = I. x eatonii Dodge (later synonym = I. x gravesii A. A. Eaton); I. flaccida; I. tuckermanii [ = I. x foveolata A. A. Eaton ex Dodge]; I. lacustris; and I. riparia [ = I. x brittonii Brunton & W. C. Taylor].
